page.title: 05HOME LIFE IN KEYINGHAM
page.content: Daily routine starts in most homes between 6.0am and 7.0am, breakfast and tea (evening meal) are usually shared by all the family. After breakfast the children go to school, by bus in this area and dad goes to work, leaving mum at home. Increasingly more women are working, if the woman does work and time for preparing food is short, a meal may be taken from the deep freezer and cooked in a micro-wave oven. Although where time permits fresh fruit, vegetables, meat and fish will be traditionally cooked. Children finish school by 4.0pm and men are home by 6.0pm, occasionally families will go out in an evening, children to Youth clubs of disco's and parents may go to a public house or club. It is still largely regarded as the womans job to look after the home and the mans to provide money for its upkeep.
